footer.p: GROWWE is a biodegradable soil alternative produced in Egypt from natural resources. GROWWE is a a sustainable eco-friendly solution developed with British technology by a license from Scaletek UK. GROWWE utilizes natural organic resources to contribute to organic agriculture while enhancing soil quality for horticulture, landscaping and farming.

homePage.title: Creating a good life | from growing good plants

smartSection.smartThirdBoxDescription: Absorbs & retains water for longer times.
smartSection.smartFourthBoxDescription: Low salt levelsÂ (safer for sensitive plants)
smartSection.smartSixthBoxDescription: Add 18 liters of water per block to get 50 liters volume.

mulch.title: Mulch
mulch.content: Mulch is a protective layer of material spread on top of the soil to protect it and decorate your landscape. Think of it like a blanket for your garden. Mulch protects the soil and the plants growing in it. It is natural, organic and reusable.

whoWeAreSection.whoDes: We are dedicated to producingÂ high-quality alternative soilÂ from Egyptâ€™s rich natural resources.
whoWeAreSection.missionDes: We aim to provideÂ eco-friendly, sustainable growing mediaÂ that empowers farmers, gardeners, and agricultural businesses to grow premium quality plants while protecting the environment.
whoWeAreSection.visionDes: To lead the global shift toward sustainable cultivation by innovating plant-based solutions that are kind to the earth and productive for farmers.

gardeningSection.title: GARDENING
gardeningSection.des1: Grow Green, Naturallyâ€”Healthy Soil for a Healthier Harvest!
gardeningSection.des2: Alternative soil is slightly acidic (pH ~5.5-6.5)â€”perfect for blueberries, azaleas, and ferns. For neutral-pH plants, balance with a bit of garden lime.

thirdSection.des1: Alternative soil is sterile and lightweightâ€”perfect for seed trays!Â Mix with vermiculite (3:1 ratio) to prevent damping-off disease and promote strong seedling roots.
thirdSection.header2: Pro Tips for Starting Seeds in Alternative Soil
thirdSection.point1: Pre-Moisten:Â Always soak alternative soil before sowing!
thirdSection.point2: Mix for Drainage:Â Add 20% perlite or vermiculite to prevent compaction.
thirdSection.point3: Warmth is Key:Â Use a heat mat (75â€“80Â°F) for tropical seeds (e.g., orchids).
thirdSection.point4: Cover for Humidity:Â Stretch plastic wrap over trays until germination.
thirdSection.point5: Transplant Early:Â Palm peat breaks down fastâ€”move seedlings once 2â€“4 true leaves appear.
thirdSection.des2: Pre-planting hack: Solarize soil with clear plastic for 2 weeks, then amend with palm peat to kill weedsÂ andÂ boost acidity.
